title: What is the mass of 2.0 moles of LiOH? - Quora

response.answer_text: The molar mass of LiOH is 23.95 g/mol. The molar mass tells you the mass of one mole of a substance. Two moles, therefore, would be twice the molar mass.

That depends on whether you mean the anhydrous or monohydrate form. The molar masses of both are given in the infobox in the Wikipedia article on lithium hydroxide; take ’em and multiply. Really, now, do just a little bit of basic research first, OK?
